Posts.Content: nancy1of1 wrote: Hi, I am 35 and new to this site.  I found out Tuesday morning that I have BC.  I am calling it my gift.  The quick rundown is IDC grade II/III with focal angiolymphatic invasion.  My hormone receptors are positive (which I guess is a good thing).  What do I do first?  I keep hearing that I need a sentinel node biopsy.  Is that something that my Dr. should offer up immediately? How do you find the best? I am lucky that I have great insurance and a family that will go to the moon for me on this.  I live in a resort town that has great sports injury Dr.'s but not too many people get BC up here.  I want the absolute best.  There has been no history of any kind of sickness in my family.  In fact, I have instantly gone to celebrity status in my family because we don't get sick.  No one get's sick.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Gift nancy1of1 nancy1of1

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2007 12:42PM nancy1of1 wrote: Shirlann, Thank you for that information.  I went yesterday to see a surgeon who recommended exactly what you mention.  I am in Sun Valley Idaho and this Dr. is from Fred Hutch in Seattle as well as the University of Washington medical center.  I am feeling surprisingly confident.  However, I like the idea of taking all the information and requesting a backup treatment recommendation.  That is good advice.  My dad is a Dr. as well as my Father-in-law (an oncologist) which I think is a good and bad thing at the same time.   I worry that I am getting too much fuel at times.  I tend to get a little overwhelmed with all the information.
Posts.Title: My Gift nancy1of1 nancy1of1

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2007 05:20PM nancy1of1 wrote: I am a very positive person as you may have figured out but I have spent my life worrying about myself with great success.  This is my wake-up call to turn my selfishness into something for others.  Breast Cancer may be the reason I am able to accomplish something so great that it will even surprise me.  I will go my own way and follow my own heart and it will take me where I need to be.  I'm afraid this forum is not for me.
